greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k), n>=1, k>=1, in which column k lists k+1 copies of the squares in nondecreasing order, and the first element of column k is in row k(k+1)/2.
comment: Gives an identity for the sum of remainders of n mod k, for k = 1,2,3,...,n. Alternating sum of row n equals A004125(n), i.e., sum_{k=1..A003056(n))} (-1)^(k-1)*T(n,k) = A004125(n).
Row n has length A003056(n) hence the first element of column k is in row A000217(k).
example: For n = 24 the 24th row of triangle is 121, 49, 16, 4, 1, 0 therefore the alternating row sum is 121 - 49 + 16 - 4 + 1 - 0 = 85 equaling A004125(24).
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Jan 23 2014
